RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH:
Obteve o tэtulo de doutor em Engenharia Mecтnica pela Universidade de Sуo Paulo EESC ? USP em 2004; щ mestre em Engenharia de Produчуo e engenheiro de Produчуo Mecтnica pela Universidade Metodista de Piracicaba. Em 1992 concluiu o curso tщcnico em mecтnica pelo Colщgio Tщcnico da UNICAMP.
Щ professor da Universidade Federal de Santa Catarina - UFSC/Joinville.
Atua e coordena diversos projetos de pesquisa, em temas relativos р fabricaчуo produtos contendo formas complexas, empregando a cadeia CAD/CAM/CNC - CAx - fabricaчуo de moldes e matrizes. Щ lэder do Grupo de Pesquisa em Manufatura Auxiliada por Computador - GPCAM.
Autor do livro: - Manufacturing Complex Geometries using High Speed Cutting Technology - pela editora VDM Verlag, 2010. Autor do livro: - Engenharia Integrada por Computador e sistemas CAD/CAM/CNC - pela editora Artliber (2013). Possui diversas publicaчѕes cientэficas em congressos e revistas nacionais e internacionais. Acrescentam-se р sua experiъncia profissional, trabalhos realizados no exterior: na empresa Delcam International plc. Inglaterra; na Universidade de Nottingham, Inglaterra; no Instituto - PTW, da Universidade Tщcnica de Darmstadt, Alemanha; no Instituto Tecnolѓgico de Monterrey, Mщxico; na Pontifэcia Universidade Catѓlica do Peru; e no Instituto Politщcnico de Leiria, Portugal.
Щ membro da Comissуo Assessora das Сreas de Tecnologia do ENADE (Exame Nacional de Desempenho de Estudantes). Щ Avaliador de Curso Superior do INEP - Сrea das Engenharias. Membro do comitъ tщcnico de Engenharia de Fabricaчуo da Associaчуo Brasileira de Ciъncias Mecтnicas - ABCM.

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN:
He obtained his Dr in Mechanical Engineering from the University of Sуo Paulo -USP in 2004; He has a Masters in Production Engineering and Mechanical Production Engineering from the Methodist University of Piracicaba. In 1992 he completed the technical course in mechanics by the Technical College of UNICAMP. He is a professor at the Federal University of Santa Catarina - UFSC / Joinville-BRAZIL. He acts and coordinates several research projects, in topics related to the manufacture of products with complex shapes, employing a chain CAD / CAM / CNC - CAx - manufacturing of molds and matrices.
He also studies the High Speed ​​Cutting (HSC) Technology. He is the leader of the Computer Aided Manufacturing Research Group - GPCAM. Author of the book: - Geometries of the manufacturing complex using high speed cutting technology - by VDM Verlag, 2010. Author of the book: - Computer Integrated Engineering and CAD / CAM / CNC systems - by Artliber (2013).
Takes part on the committee of the Brazilian Association of Technical Standards (ABNT) CEE-261 - for elaboration / revision of the Brazilian Standards on Additive Manufacture.
Associate Editor of the Journal of the Brazilian Society of Mechanical Sciences and Engineering - Springer.
He has several scientific publications in congresses and national and international journals. In addition to his professional experience, work has been carried out abroad: at Delcam International plc. England; at the University of Nottingham, England; no Institute - PTW, Technical University of Darmstadt, Germany; no Technological Institute of Monterrey, Mexico; at the Pontifical Catholic University of Peru; and not the Polytechnic Institute of Leiria, Portugal. He is a member of the Advisory Committee of the Technology Areas of the ENADE (National Student Performance Exam). Evaluator of Higher Course of INEP - Engineering Department. Member of the technical committee of Engineering of Manufacturing of the Brazilian Association of Mechanical Sciences - ABCM. (Text)

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: SANTANDER UNIVERSITIES SCHEME - SYNER_MOULD (Synergies in Manufacture and Exploitation of High-Precision Moulds and Dies)
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Estudo de novos processos de fabricaчуo de moldes e matrizes empregando usinagem em 5 eixos.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO-INGLES: SYNER_MOULD aims to explore innovative and integrative methods for manufacture and exploitation of moulds and dies. This industrial segment has a key position on current marketing. It influences diverse manufacturing chain, like as: electronics, electro domestics, automotive, aerospace, medical equipments and so on. This industrial segment still demands technical and scientific development. Due to its technical complexity and possible industrial impact, three year duration of SYNER_MOULD project. 1. Project Aims A.Seek innovative routes and production platforms for more efficient manufacture of macro/micro moulds and dies. B.Scrutinize methods for enhancing the service life of macro & micro moulds/dies. C.Search for techniques that can actively monitor the behaviour of moulds/dies under working condition and appropriate simulation methods. 2. Educational benefits from SYNER_MOULD A.Both SOCIESC and University of Nottingham will be able to utilise parts of the project findings as case studies for appropriate BEng/MEng/MSc courses. B.Academic papers will be published. C.Short research seminars for post-graduate students are predicted when a foreigner research visits the institution counterpart. This activity aims to promote integration between research groups from the two academic institutions. This will be carefully planned against workpackages (based on the mentioned aims) and synchronised by annual meetings at both institutions.

O grupo de pesquisa teve apoio inicial do PROGRAMA INSTITUTOS DO MILЪNIO Edital MCT/CNPq 01/2005 - Instituto Fсbrica do Milъnio. O projeto de pesquisa classifica-se na сrea das engenharias III, processos de fabricaчуo e materiais e focarс o estudo e desenvolvimento dos processos de usinagem por fresamento de moldes e matrizes contendo formas geomщtricas complexas. Este tema de pesquisa щ abordado nas atividades do grupo de pesquisa PROMOLDE, o qual possui natureza multidisciplinar e interinstitucional. Este grupo de pesquisa instrumentaliza e dс sinergia a trabalhos de pesquisa do Curso de Mestrado em Engenharia Mecтnica do IST, o qual щ um importante instrumento de formaчуo e pesquisa, nesta сrea, para a regiуo norte de Santa Catarina. Desta forma, a atual proposta encontra-se em plena consonтncia com as linhas de pesquisa do grupo PROMOLDE e do referido curso de mestrado. Espera-se com este projeto aprimorar a formaчуo profissional de alunos de graduaчуo e mestrado, apoiando a vocaчуo regional, concentrada na indњstria metal-mecтnica, geraчуo de publicaчѕes cientэficas, promoчуo de intercambio com outras instituiчѕes de pesquisas nacionais (em paralelo a demais projetos em desenvolvimento pelo grupo de pesquisa), fortalecendo o desenvolvimento da CT&I.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: RMM PROJECT - RAPID MOULD MANUFACTURING. MOULD MANUFACTURING BY SELECTIVE LASER MELTING
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The Rapid Mould Manufacturing project (RMM) investigates products manufactured by the injection of polymerizes using different mould materials and alternative methods for mould manufacturing. The plastic product and the injection process are evaluated. The morphological characterization, degree of crystallinity, warpage, mechanical properties, the parameters of injection processes, tooling life, the manufacturing time and costs were assessed from the products injected in each case.

The plastic product and the injection process are evaluated. The morphological characterization, degree of crystallinity, warpage, mechanical properties, the parameters of injection processes, tooling life, the manufacturing time and costs were assessed from the products injected in each case.

LINHA-DE-PESQUISA.OBJETIVOS-LINHA-DE-PESQUISA:
Estudar novos processos de fabricaчуo por adiчуo de material (SLM-Selective Laser Melting) para a fabricaчуo de moldes. Esta tщcnica de fabricaчуo permiti contruir formas complexas com materiais metсlicos e elevadas propriedades mecтnicas.
Estuda-se nesta linha o desenvolvimento deste processo de fabricaчуo e suas aplicaчѕes. Em foco a fabricaчуo de moldes para a injeчуo de plсsticos contendo canais complexos de refrigeraчуo (conhecido por "conformal cooling").
Simulaчѕes computacionais por elementos finitos (sistema CAE) sуo investigadas com a instrumentaчуo de moldes, empregando sensores de pressуo e temperatura. Os produtos plсsticos fabricados por estes moldes sуo avaliados e caracteridados.

Este projeto tem por objetivo:
1- Estudar os parтmetros de fabricaчуo de peчas metсlicas em aчo CORRAX empregando a tщcnica de manufatura aditiva atravщs do processo SLM (Selective Laser Melting).
2- Avaliar a influъncia destes parтmetros nas peчas fabricadas por SLM, atravщs das propriedades: a. Densidade das peчas. b. Micro-dureza. c. Rugosidade superficial. d. DRX. e. Anсlise metalogrсfica.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: RMM - RAPID MOULD MANUFACTURING PROJECT. MOULD MANUFACTURING BY SELECTIVE LASER SINTERING
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
The Rapid Mould Manufacturing project (RMM) has the aim to investigate plastic products injected in different mould materials and alternative methods for mould manufacturing. The final plastic product and the injection process are evaluated. The morphological characterization, degree of crystallinity, warpage, mechanical properties, the parameters of injection processes, tooling life, the manufacturing time and costs were assessed from the products injected in each case.
The aim of this study is to characterize the product injected into a cavity produced by the manufacturing process: selective laser sintering (SLS) and compare it with previous studies, which uses a mould manufactured by conventional methods.
The morphological characterization, degree of crystallinity, warpage, mechanical properties and the parameters of injection processes were accessed from the products injected in each case. Studies will be carried-out in order to evaluate the best combination between milling and SLS techniques to manufacture the mould cavities concerning time and costs, according to the parts of the mould to be manufactured.
Sensors (from KistlerЎ) were installed in the tooling for measuring in real time the pressure and temperature inside the cavity and simulation by FEA are carried out to support the process characterization.
